original: Celander, Karl Hildingr» professor, fd. rektor, Göteborg, f. 17/7/76 i Arboga av folksk :lär. G. M. C. o. Elise Sörman. G. 14 m. Vera Hoffmann. Barn: Bengt f. 15, Inga 17, Sven 18, Karin 20, Gösta o. Olov 23. — Stud:-ex. i Örebro 94, fil. kand. i Upps. 97, fil. lic. 04, fil. dr 06. Res. t. dåv. Kristiania s. inneh. av fjärdenov :stip. 05, Tyskl. 06, Frankr. m. statsstip. f. stud. av modersm :und :visn. v. de franska lycéerna 20, Frankr. o. Ital. 30, Norge, Danm. o. Finl., särsk. f. språk- o. folklorist. stud. uppr. ggr. fr. 01, medv. i lär:kurser i Köpenhamn 09 o. 13, i Ribe 19, i Borgå 22, i Hinds-gavl 23, t. Norge f. föredr. o. uppläsn. på uppdr. av fören. Norden 25, 27 o. 28. Doc. i nord. språk i Upps. 07-10, doc. v. Gbgs högsk. 11-32, förest, f. Upps. univ. föreläsn :byrå 09-10, vik. adj. v. Upps. folksk :sem. 05, lektor v. Gbgs real 10-42, studirektor v. Gbgs lyc. f. fl. 17-38, rektor v. h. a. 1. f. fl. i Gbg 29-42, tillades professors namn 46. Sekr. i Modersm :lär. fören. 12-27, led. av styr. f. Aug. Abrahamssons stift, på Nääs 24-29, ordf. i styr. f. inst. f. folkminnesforskn. v. Gbgs högsk. 26-46. Skr.: Lokes mytiska ursprung (11), Studentexamen (17), Gymnasiereformen (tills. m. Malte Jacobsson 19), Närkiska folkminnen (22), Nord. jul I (28), Barfotaspringningen v. vårdagjämningstiden (44), Några danska o. svenska julvisor (46), tid-skr :upps., utg. Saga o. sanning, Vers o. prosa o. Nord. läsn. (tills. m. Jeanna Oterdahl). KN02kl, HedLGAA, LVVS.
translated:
Celander, Karl Hildingr, professor, former rector, Gothenburg, born on July 17th, 1876 in Arboga. His father was a teacher. He married C. and Elise Sörman, and later married Vera Hoffmann in 1914. They had six children: Bengt (born in 1915), Inga (1917), Sven (1918), Karin (1920), Gösta and Olov (1923). Celander took his studentexamen in Örebro in 1894, and became Fil. Kand. in Uppsala in 1897. He became Fil. Lic. in 1904, and received his Fil. Dr. in 1906. He was a recipient of the fjärdenov stipendium in 1905, which allowed him to visit Kristiania (now Oslo). He also studied in Germany in 1906 and France through a state scholarship for studies in the French language and literature with French Lyceens, in 1920 and 1930 he studied in France and Italy, and had research trips to Norway, Denmark and Finland.

Celander was a docent in Nordic languages at Uppsala University from 1907-1910, and a docent at Gothenburg University from 1911-1932. He was the head of the University of Uppsala's lecture bureau from 1909-1910, a temporary teacher at Uppsala teachers' college in 1905. He was a lecturer at Gothenburg Real School from 1910-1942, director of studies at Gothenburg Lycée for several years starting in 1917, rector at H.A.1 in Gothenburg from 1929-1942, and was granted the title of professor in 1946. He served as secretary of the Association of Swedish Teachers of Mother Tongue from 1912-1927, was a member of the board of August Abrahamssons stift (foundation) at Nääs from 1924-1929, and chairman of the board of the Institute for Folklore Research at Gothenburg University from 1926-1946. 

Celander authored several books, including "Lokes mytiska ursprung" (Loki's Mythical Origin) in 1911, "Studentexamen" (Student Examination) in 1917, "Gymnasiereformen" (High School Reform) with Malte Jacobsson in 1919, "Närkiska folkminnen" (Närke's Folklore) in 1922, "Nord. jul I" (Nordic Christmas I) in 1928, "Barfotaspringningen v. vårdagjämningstiden" (Barefoot Running at the Equinox) in 1944, and "Några danska o. svenska julvisor" (Some Danish and Swedish Christmas Songs) in 1946. He also edited several periodicals, including "Saga och Sanning" (Saga and Truth), "Vers och Prosa" (Verse and Prose), and "Nordisk Läsnng" (Nordic Reading) with Jeanna Oterdahl. He was a recipient of the Royal Order of the 2nd Class of the North Star and the Royal Order of the Seraphim, as well as the letter art award from the Gothenburg Arts and Crafts Association.
